title: Unclear error message regarding try-op + type-inference + trait bounds

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
```rust
#![feature(proc_macro_path_invoc)]

#[derive(serde_derive::Deserialize)]
struct Options {
    username: String,
}

fn read() -> Result<Options, toml::de::Error> {
    toml::from_str("")?
}

```

Error:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `toml::de::Error: _IMPL_DESERIALIZE_FOR_Options::_serde::Deserialize<'_>` is not satisfied
 --> src/lib.rs:9:5
  |
9 |     toml::from_str("")?
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `_IMPL_DESERIALIZE_FOR_Options::_serde::Deserialize<'_>` is not implemented for `toml::de::Error`
  |
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `_IMPL_DESERIALIZE_FOR_Options::_serde::Deserialize<'_>` for `std::result::Result<Options, toml::de::Error>`
  = note: required by `toml::de::from_str`

error: aborting due to previous error

```

Is it possible to improve the error on this one?

Playground: https://play.rust-lang.org/?gist=a98bbce6f339c98be03ac684ac032fff&version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018
